articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said on Tuesday it had elected deputy head Naim Qassem to succeed slain secretary general Hassan Nasrallah, who was killed in an Israeli air attack on Beirut's southern suburb over a month ago.
articles.title: Hezbollah elects Naim Qassem to succeed slain head Nasrallah

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 55 Palestinians were killed and dozens others wounded in an Israeli strike on a residential building in the northern Gaza town of Beit Lahiya on Tuesday, the Palestinian Civil Emergency Service said.
articles.title: At least 55 Palestinians killed in strike on Beit Lahiya, Gaza emergency service says

articles.author: Mohammed Salem
articles.description: After more than a year of war, Abu Razzak Al-Qassas and his family live in a makeshift shelter within a cemetery in the southern Gaza Strip, dependent on food donations for survival.
articles.title: Gazan family seeks shelter from war among graves

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Falling debris from a destroyed Russian drone injured two people and set a residential building on fire in Kyiv, the mayor of the Ukrainian capital said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Two people injured in Russia's drone attack on Ukraine's Kyiv, mayor says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Laurie Chen, Yimou Lee
articles.description: China wanted the US to say "we oppose Taiwan independence," rather than the current version, which is that the United States "does not support" independence for Taiwan, sources told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: China's Xi pressed Biden to alter language on Taiwan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Georgia's central electoral commission said it would recount ballots at some 14% of polling stations on Tuesday after independent monitors raised concerns about the conduct of Saturday's parliamentary election.
articles.title: Georgia conducts partial vote recount after reports of polling irregularities

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Tuesday he had agreed with South Korea's president to step up contacts between their nations at all levels to develop countermeasures and a strategy to respond to North Korea's involvement in the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Ukraine, S.Korea to enhance cooperation to counter N.Korea, Zelenskiy says

articles.author: Emma Farge
articles.description: Sudan's Rapid Support Forces (RSF) and allies have committed "staggering" levels of sexual abuse, raping civilians as troops advance and abducting some women as sex slaves during the more than 18-month war, a U.N. mission said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Sudan's RSF and allies sexually abused victims from 8-75 years, UN mission says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico will visit China from Oct. 30 to Nov. 5 to meet its leaders and foster closer bilateral and economic ties, his government said on Tuesday, as Slovakia aims to build alliances outside its European Union and NATO partners.
articles.title: Slovak PM Fico to visit China as he seeks ties beyond western partners

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: A shock election result in Japan, Washington's key Asian security ally, and the United States' potentially destabilising presidential election next week could provide an opportunity for China and other rivals to test Western resolve in East Asia.
articles.title: Election shock in key US ally Japan could embolden China, other rivals
